Several shareholders and capital markets observers have questioned to Tribune Business why CIBC FirstCaribbean did not book the $ 174 million net loss at its 2013 year - end , and effectively got ' all the bad news ' out the way one time .
The bank incurred a first - ever annual net loss of $ 17.9 million for the year to end - October 2013 , and appears set for a repeat performance this year .

CIBC FirstCaribbean 's 2013 year - end accounts show that a total $ 358 million worth of loans , in a portfolio worth $ 2.222 billion , were non-performing .

Personal loans brought up the rear at $ 43.258 million .
